Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Phylloseptin-PTa (XXA; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, the Brown-bellied Leaf Frog,Phyllomedusa tarsius, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (94.7%) toPhylloseptin-PC, differing only at residue 10 (G10 here vs. T10).Activity: Active against S. aureus NCTC 10788 (MIC 4.14 uM),  MRSA NCTC 10788 (4.14 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 16.56 uM), E. coli  NCTC 10418 (MIC 16.56 uM), C. albicans NCYC 1467 (MIC 2.07 uM). Antibiofilm against S. aureus MBEC = 4 uM.Structure: Helical in 50% TFE.Toxicity:  50% hemolytic concentration (HC50) 22.8 uM, highly hemolytic.  Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Liu J, Wu Q, Li L, Xi X, Wu D, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L.2017
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of Phylloseptins that Defense against Gram-Positive Bacteria and Inhibit the Proliferation of the Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Cell Line, from the Skin Secretions of Phyllomedusa Frogs
